mdRecord.dcterms:title: WSLS-TV'S Jim Walsh interviews Benjamin F. Moomaw on Roanoke, Va., Diamond Jubilee celebration
mdRecord.dcterms:description: WSLS-TV reporter Jim Walsh speaks with Benjamin F. Moomaw, managing director of the Roanoke, Va., "Diamond Jubilee" 75th anniversary festival, which will celebrate community acheivements over the 75 years since the village of Big Lake, Va., was renamed "Roanoke." Moomaw emphasizes the importance of the Shenandoah Valley Railroad in establishing Roanoke as the fastest-growing community in the state of Virginia and details the festival's main events: a historical pageant and an exhibit showcasing local industries, headed by Norfolk and Western Railway President R.H. Smith.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Anniversaries
Festivals
